content: Well, it has been said that Obama has no intention of pushing or passing any legislation to restrict people from exercising their 2nd amendment right to own, use and carry firearms. Well, has it occurred to anyone that he does not need to use the legislative process in order to restrict people from exercising their 2nd amendment right? There is a little thing called a treaty which can make this process much easier for Obama to reach these aims. All that is needed for a treaty to become law (and thus part of our Constitution) is it to pass the Senate. With the Senate very close to having 60 Democratic seats (enough to prevent a Republican filibuster), that probably will not be very hard to do. And, one high priority of the Obama admin is to pass CIFTA. The passing of CIFTA would essentially do what the Democrats have been wanting to do for years. So, if you support the 2nd amendment, I highly recommend that you start contacting your Senators now.

title: Obama and guns

content: quote: Originally posted by Thud357L: quote: Originally posted by Woody_in_La: quote: Originally posted by Thud357L: What is CIFTA and how does it threaten my right to own guns? Let me help you out.... http://www.state.gov/p/wha/rls/49907.htm Thanks but after reading it, it looks like it's about state's rights to control illegal guns. Isn't most of that stuff on the books anyway? I guess I'm having a hard time discerning the actual threat. Far as I'm concerned nobody is going to take our guns away. Nobody CAN take our guns away. The "states" in that proposed treaty are nations in the Western Hemisphere. What it proposes to do is to combat the transfer of illegal weapons between the countries which sign on. In other words, it's a "gun-running" treaty and nothing more. I suppose we COULD read all kinds of things into it and speculate about future, incremental steps which MIGHT be made, but as with any proposed thing like that, it's better to just let the words speak for themselves.

In other words, it's a "gun-running" treaty and nothing more. I suppose we COULD read all kinds of things into it and speculate about future, incremental steps which MIGHT be made, but as with any proposed thing like that, it's better to just let the words speak for themselves.

content: At this time the army is trying to make each soldier register thier P.O.W.'s Personaly owned weapons. Whether they are on post or in the state the soldier is stationed in or not dosent matter. They have given each soldier a form to fill out and hand in. All weapons with serial #'s ,Make ,model and caliber must be listed along with the location of the P.O.W. IF THE ENEMY IS IN RANGE , SO ARE YOU. I.Y.A.O.Y.A.S.
